thread.title: Gates, Buffett, Top Tech CEOs Lead Super-Rich List
thread.title_full: Gates, Buffett, Top Tech CEOs Lead Super-Rich List

title: Gates, Buffett, Top Tech CEOs Lead Super-Rich List
text:
4 More Hot Stocks Hit New Highs As Market Improves 
The list of leading stocks hitting new highs is broadening as the market shows signs of improvement. After starting the week with mostly defensive plays such as food and utilities, new highs in tech, retail and real estate are joining in. As of midday Wednesday, Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) was up 0.84, or ... 02:28 PM ET Facebook Heads 4 Tech Leaders Losing Key Support Area 
In a market correction, even leading stocks usually succumb. Facebook (NASDAQ:FB), Google (NASDAQ:GOOGL), Palo Alto Networks (NYSE:PANW) and Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) are all tech leaders, but they stocks fallen below a critical support area. All four stocks are part of IBD's Young Guns Screen of the ... 02:06 PM ET Greg Steltenpohl Innovates To The Top With Beverages 
Greg Steltenpohl is a pioneer in the nonalcoholic beverage industry. And he has advice for the entrepreneur who thirsts to make it big. If you want to win in a product category, study hard and truly grasp what your competitors do. Then go out and create something unique. Or make the product a ... 02:05 PM ET Stock Rally Losing Steam Again; Facebook Up Sharply On China Hopes 
Stocks nearly halved their gains in early afternoon trading after starting out strong on a better-than-expected September jobs report. The Nasdaq, up as much as 2.2% earlier, led with a 1.3% gain. The S&P 500 was up 1% and the Dow Jones industrial average climbed 0.7%. Volume was tracking ... 01:35 PM ET Biotech And Emerging Market ETFs Lead Rally 
Exchange traded funds jabbed higher Wednesday, as investors cheered a biotech rally and strong performance in overseas markets. Major Asian markets closed higher after the release of positive data on Chinese consumer sentiment, with the upbeat mood rippling across to Europe. At Wednesday's open, ... 12:23 PM ET Baidu Downgraded; Valeant Soars On Analyst Move 
Chinese Internet search engine Baidu (NASDAQ:BIDU) was downgraded early Wednesday, while drugmakers Valeant Pharmaceuticals International (NYSE:VRX) and Shire (NASDAQ:SHPG) also saw analyst action. Baidu was downgraded to hold at Summit Research and given a 170 price target, which is below the ... 02:16 PM ET Costco's Comp Sales Drop For Second Straight Quarter 
Costco Wholesale (NASDAQ:COST) reported fourth-quarter earnings that topped views late Tuesday, but the giant warehouse club operator posted a decline in same-store sales and fell short on total revenue as it got stung by low gas prices and foreign exchange headwinds. Costco reported fourth-quarter ... 01:55 PM ET Tech Disrupters May Cut Banks' Retail Profit By 60% 
Digital disruption could erase nearly two-thirds of banks' earnings on certain financial products such as credit cards and auto loans over the next decade, according to a study by the McKinsey consultancy firm. Financial tech startups may slash such non-mortgage retail earnings by 60% and revenue ... 01:51 PM ET IPO Watch: Square, Ferrari To Start Trading Soon? 
FitBit (NYSE:FIT) and Shake Shack (NYSE:SHAK) aren't the last high-profile companies going public in 2015, say analysts. Tech IPOs have only accounted for 11% of IPOs for the year, the least in seven years, say analysts, but there's a big name on tap in Square, helmed by Twitter (NYSE:TWTR) ... 01:22 PM ET Can Starboard Lift Advance Auto Stock Like Darden's? 
Starboard Value LP, the New York-based activist investor, bought a 3.7% stake in Advance Auto Parts (NYSE:AAP) and is pushing the retailer to boost its margins. Earlier this month, Starboard met with Advance Auto Parts CEO Darren Jackson about how to boost the company's stock price to more than ... 12:43 PM ET
